intro: Amaioua edulis, commonly known as the edible amaioua, is a tropical plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and produces showy, pink or red flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is often grown for its ornamental value as well as its edible parts. However, it is important to note that not all parts of the plant are safe for consumption.
